task: Line t is defined by the equation $ 9y + -14x = 18 $. Line j is perpendicular to line t in the xy-plane. What is the slope of line j?
explanation: The given equation of line t is rewritten in slope-intercept form as $ y = \frac{14}{9}x + b $. This means the slope of line t is \frac{14}{9}. The negative reciprocal of a number is -1 divided by the number. Therefore, the negative reciprocal of \frac{14}{9} is \frac{-9}{14}. Thus, the slope of line j is \frac{-9}{14}.
